definition: dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
grass radical 草字頭兒|草字头儿[cao3 zi4 tou2 r5]
color/complexion/looks/variant of 彩[cai3]/variant of 採|采[cai3]
oilseed rape (Brassica napus)/flowering edible rape (Brassica chinensis var. oleifera)

sentences.english: This dish needs a little salt.
Well, it all looks so good. How about ordering the steamed prawns?
sentences.chinese: 這兒的菜看着都不錯，我們要一份蒸蝦怎麼樣？

sentences.english: TAPAS BAR offers Spanish cuisine. The price is reasonable and the environment is extraordinary.
sentences.chinese: 三樂維提供西班牙菜，以價格適中和環境幽雅出衆。

sentences.english: I think Chinese food is perfect in color, aroma and taste.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得中餐菜真是色香味俱佳。

sentences.english: Give me home-cooked food, especially hummus.
sentences.chinese: 我就要家鄉菜，尤其是胡姆斯。

sentences.english: Well, there are eight different Chinese cuisines.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，中國菜包括八大菜系。

sentences.english: Nothing pleased my mother more than to be told how good were her dishes.
sentences.chinese: 誇母親的菜做得多好，沒什麼比這更使她高興的了。

sentences.english: The content of different form nitrogen in vegetable field is higher than wood soil.
sentences.chinese: 土壤中各種形態氮的含量菜地上壤高於林地土壤。

sentences.english: Have I served you everything by now?
She eked out the stew to make another meal.
sentences.chinese: 她省出一些鈍菜再做一頓飯。

sentences.english: What is the Battle Between the Dragon and the Tiger?
sentences.chinese: 龍虎鬥是一道什麼樣的菜？

sentences.english: Amused, the shopkeeper asked what I wanted this alleged green leaf for.
sentences.chinese: 菜店老闆就很開心地問我要這種綠色的葉子做什麼用。

sentences.english: So none of us ever liked this diner?
sentences.chinese: 所以，我們都不喜歡這的菜？

sentences.english: There are mainly eight famous Chinese cuisines .
The accompanying ginger and plainly cooked broccoli also help offset the fat.
sentences.chinese: 配着的姜和簡單燒過的西蘭花菜也幫助抵消脂肪。

definition: non-vegetarian dish (including meat, fish, garlic, onion etc)
appetizer/small side dish/easy job/piece of cake/see also 小菜一碟[xiao3 cai4 yi1 die2]
to smell, look and taste great
dish consisting of stir-fried potato, eggplant and green pepper
to be fond of eating/to be gluttonous
